page.title: 15GUILDFORD: POPULATION
page.content: The population of Guildford is measured for both the District and the town centre. The District population, taken from the 1981 Census, is 122,200 and the town population, taken from the District figures is 56,652. The actual density of population in Guildford is 19.1 persons per square hectare. There are 42,838 households in the District with an average of 2.9 people per household. The information on car ownership shows that there are on average 1.2 cars per head. The economically active population is 58,138 , ie. just under half the total population. The labour force in the area is 58,900 , showing a movement of labour into the area. {By Nicola Deighton and { Ian Westley
